Headline: HUL shares plunge over 3% after Q1 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
Summary: Despite reporting a 3% YoY increase in net profit at Rs 2,538 crore for the quarter ending June 30, 2024, in line with the Street's estimate of Rs 2,541 crore, Hindustan Unilever (HUL) saw its shares plummet by 3.3% to Rs 2,674 in Wednesday's intraday trade on BSE.

Headline: F&O STT hike in Union Budget: Much ado about nothing?
Summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman raised the STT on options to 0.1% effective October 1. Analysts predict minimal impact. SEBI's 'True to label' circular targets retail speculation, as highlighted by Madhabi Puri Buch. Dhiraj Relli notes adaptability. The Economic Survey cautions on retail speculation. India's strong presence in global options trading and high trade losses are noted.

Headline: These 5 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
Macobs Technologies stock debuts with 28% premium over issue price
Summary: Macobs Technologies debuted on the NSE SME with a 28% premium, opening at Rs 96 compared to the issue price of Rs 75/share. Pre-listing, the company's shares traded with a Rs 14 premium in the unlisted market. The IPO, offering 25.95 lakh fresh equity shares, was oversubscribed over 200 times due to robust demand from non-institutional investors.

Headline: Natco Pharma and 4 other stocks closed above VWAP

Positive Breakout: Kotak Mahindra bank and 6 other stocks close above their 200 DMA
Kataria Industries shares list at 90% premium on NSE SME platform
Summary: Kataria Industries debuted on the NSE SME platform with a 90% premium, opening at Rs 182.4 compared to the IPO price of Rs 96 per share. Pre-listing, shares traded with a Rs 105 premium in the unlisted market. The IPO, offering 56.85 lakh shares, was oversubscribed over 300 times due to robust demand from non-institutional investors. Proceeds will fund plant expansion, debt repayment, and corporate needs.

Headline: ITC shares rally nearly 10% in 2 sessions to cross Rs 500 mark
Summary: ITC's shares soared nearly 10% in 2 days, surpassing Rs 500 and hitting a record Rs 510.60 on BSE. A 5% jump followed after the government kept tobacco tax rates unchanged. Taxation, handled by the GST Council, includes NCCD on cigarettes, adjustable in Budget.

Headline: MRF to trade ex-dividend tomorrow, last chance for Rs 194 dividend eligibility
Summary: MRF declared a Rs 194 Q4FY24 dividend per share and a total annual dividend of Rs 200 for FY24, with a July 25 record date. Shares closed at Rs 1,31,267.70 on BSE. Prior dividends include Rs 3 interim and Rs 169 final.

Headline: Sensex, Nifty edge lower as tax hike on capital gains dents sentiment

Experts expect the Nifty 50 to resume its upward journey soon towards 24,850 as long as it holds the 24,300-24,200 levels. What should be the strategy post Budget and which stocks should you keep on your buy list? Also in focus today will be HUL and Bajaj Finace that reported earnings yesterday. Among key earnings today, watch out for L&T & Axis Bank. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives) at Axis Securities.
